name: getDevice
description:
You need to provide a Device ID:
-use the hardware/devices service to get all available device IDs.

$ul: **agentId**: The ID of the PATROL Agent the device is attached to.
**agentName**: The name of the PATROL Agent the device is attached to.
**ambientTemperature**: The ambient temperature of the device.

**collectTime**: The collection time of the heating margin (as an Epoch time, in seconds).
Note:This field will only be present if a value could be found.
**deviceTSMOKey**: The TSMOKey of the device.
**deviceUrl**: The link to the device details.

**heatingMargin**: The heating margin of the device.
Note:This field will only be present if a value could be found.

**heatingMarginUnit**: The unit in which the heating margin of the device is being expressed.
Note:This field will only be present if a value could be found.
**id**: The ID of the device.
**name**: The ID of the device.
**powerConsumption**: The power consumption of the device.
**powerConsumptionUnit**: The unit in which the power consumption of the device is being expressed.

**productVersion**: The Hardware Sentry KM version of the device's Monitor.
Note:This field will only be present if a value could be found.
**serverId**: The ID of the server the device is attached to.
**serverName**: The name of the server the device is attached to.
**sid**: The SID of the device.
**type**
**updateTimestamp**: The data collection time (as an Epoch time, in seconds).
**code**: The error's business identifier.
**date**: The timestamp of the error.
**message**: The error message.
**code**: The error's business identifier.
**date**: The timestamp of the error.
**message**: The error message.
